activities_info.details: Students at Sidney Kimmel Medical College have worked to create a Jefferson COVID-19 Student Volunteerism Platform, which serves as a centralized forum for the development and advertisement of projects to support both the Jefferson Health System and the community at large. Please find a list of volunteer initiatives that have been developed for advertisement on the Platform by Jefferson students and organizations or other members of the community. You may also click here to view many more opportunities. If you have any general questions or questions about projects that were specifically developed to support clinical departments in the Jefferson Health System (not listed below), please contact us.

COVID: decoded is a blog and resource center providing up-to-date and easy to read info for the public. There are daily blogs, terms, FAQs, and a resource center for COVID info, mental health, hotlines, exercise, volunteers, donations, and interpreting the news. Created by medical students at SKMC and advised by an MD, we are now a growing collaboration across institutions, e.g., Temple, Drexel, and Penn. Find us at www.coviddecoded.com and @COVIDdecoded on FB, Twiter, and IG. Get in touch for the blog, website/SEO, social media, or suggestions!

directusSchool.name: Sidney Kimmel Medical College at Thomas Jefferson University
